The National Startup Awards (NSA) spotlight purpose-driven startups building #innovative, #scalable, and #inclusive solutions. From healthcare and sustainability to agriculture, education, and finance, these changemakers are solving real-world challenges.

NSA recognition opens doors to policy influence, #global exposure, and funding, thereby, turning bold ideas into real-world impact.

ğŸ† Innaumation Medical Devices Private Limited created Aum Voice, an affordable voice prosthesis for throat cancer patients, which gained global exposure following their NSA win and a feature at the Tata Social Enterprise Challenge.
 
ğŸ† MiCoB was invited to the President with Startups initiative post-NSA and secured a major defense order through iDEX, a powerful example of policy enabling innovation.
 
ğŸ† Blackfrog Technologies built Emvolio, a WHO-prequalified portable vaccine carrier, whichâ€”backed by NSA and a â‚¹10 lakh grantâ€”is now deployed across 16 Indian states and expanding to Kenya, Nigeria, and Fiji.

ğŸ‰ Big congratulations to Dozee, one of IKP-supported startups, on receiving the CE mark for its AI-powered Remote Patient Monitoring (RPM) system! 

This regulatory milestone opens the door to 30+ countries across the European Economic Area, taking Dozeeâ€™s Made-in-India innovation to global healthcare markets. With a contactless sensor and AI-powered early warning system, Dozee tracks vitals like heart rate, oxygen saturation, and temperatureâ€”empowering proactive, data-driven care.

From securing US FDA 510(k) clearance to impacting 300+ hospitals across India, the US, Middle East, and Africa, Dozee exemplifies how Indian deeptech can drive world-class, scalable healthcare solutions.

Here's to more innovations from India transforming careâ€”one vital sign at a time.

We are proud to share that Deep Algorithms Solutions, one of our incubated portfolio startups at IIT Mandi Catalyst, has successfully raised â‚¹10.8 crore ($1.25 million) in a seed funding round led by Unicorn India Ventures, with participation from several esteemed angel investors.

Founded by J P Mishra in December 2021, Deep Algorithms Solutions is a pioneering behavioral cybersecurity and AI startup committed to tackling sophisticated cyber fraud. The startup leverages indigenous AI and behavioral intelligence to address critical challenges in digital identity security and real-time application protection.

This milestone funding reinforces confidence in their vision and the impactful problem they are solving â€” Identity Security and Real-Time Application Security powered by AI and Behavioral Intelligence.

ğŸ™ We at DERBI Foundation extend our sincere appreciation to Dr. Raghunandan N K for conducting a high-impact workshop on the Business Model Canvas (BMC) for our startup cohort.

ğŸ•´ The session offered deep insights into how startups can move beyond traditional business planning to embrace flexible, iterative, and value-driven models. 

ğŸª From refining the value proposition and customer segmentation to mapping key metrics, pricing strategies, and leveraging unfair advantages, the workshop equipped our founders with practical tools to build, test, and evolve their models.

Key highlights included:
 âœ… Understanding the BMC framework and its adaptability
 âœ… The Build-Measure-Learn loop in validating startup assumptions
 âœ… Identifying customer pain points and market demand
 âœ… Real-life examples that grounded theory in startup reality

Thank you, Dr. Raghunandan, for empowering our startups with the clarity and structure needed to navigate their growth with confidence and strategy!

As Indiaâ€™s agriculture sector grapples with climate uncertainty, water stress, and rising input costs, the need for resilient, scalable innovations has never been more urgent.Â  

Krishi Mangal, an initiative by Social Alpha and Cisco CSR, is looking for start-ups working to shape the future of agriculture. 

Now in its third edition, Krishi Mangal invites applications from start-ups developing affordable, scalable, and field-validated technologies that strengthen Indiaâ€™s agricultural resilience.Â  

The program is open to innovations solving for Integrated Farming Management, Soil Rejuvenation and Irrigation Management, Farm Mechanisation, Post-Harvest Management, and Livestock Waste Management.Â  

Applications close on 13th July 2025.Â Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture #FarmersDeserveDeepTech

Indiaâ€™s livestock sector is growingâ€”but so is the waste it generates. 

Inadequate waste management leads to methane emissions, groundwater contamination, and health risks for farm-adjacent and farming communities.Â 
At the same time, this waste stream holds untapped valueâ€”from clean energy to soil health to circular inputs for agriculture. 

Weâ€™re inviting start-ups using AI/ML and IoT in developing solutions that: 

- Transform livestock waste into biogas, biofertilisers, or organic inputsÂ 
- Build decentralised, efficient processing systemsÂ 
- Reduce handling complexity and make adoption feasible for small farmersÂ 
- Enable climate-positive, income-generating uses of dairy or poultry waste 

Solutions should be scalable, sustainable, and relevant to low-resource rural or peri-urban contexts. 

Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and prototyping support, incubation, expert mentorship, and access to implementation and capital partners. 

Applications close on 13th July 2025.Â Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Wrapping Up: KVK Baramati's Agri-Innovation Insights!

Our Day 3 in Pune concluded on a high note with a visit to KVK Baramati! We were impressed by the new farming techniques brought in collaboration with international partners and how startups leverage KVK's farmer network for idea validation and reach.

Special thanks to Abhishek Gite, Incubation Manager, for the excellent guided tour.

This inspiring visit officially concludes our memorable Pune adventure, enriching our understanding of the region's vibrant startup landscape.

Rajendra Pawar| Agricultural Development Trust Baramati | Manish Jaiswal | Jaya Tiwari | Amit Singal | Krushik App, KVK, Baramati | Yash Mittal | Rashmi Joshi | Varadh Kulkarni | Soumya Chaugala | Chetan Madivalar 

#PuneEcosystem #KVKBaramati #AgriInnovation #StartupSupport #RuralTech #DeshpandeStartups

Day 3: Exploring Innovation in Baramati at AIC - ADT Baramati Foundation!

Our deep dive into the Pune startup ecosystem continued on Day 3, taking us to Baramati for an insightful visit to the AIC-ADT Baramati Foundation! It was truly inspiring to understand the dynamic ecosystem thriving in a Tier 3 city.

A heartfelt thank you to Abhishek Gite, Incubation Manager; Sonali Saste, Incubation Manager; and Avinash Pudale, Technology Manager, for their valuable time and for sharing their work.

We gained key insights into their success, including:
â€¢ A strong on-ground network with KVK Baramati, local industry partners like Baramati Agro Ltd, and their educational institutes.
â€¢ A clear sector focus on agri and allied sectors, fostering organic collaborations and expertise.
â€¢ International collaborations bringing global resources to the grassroots level.
â€¢ A model of smaller cohort sizes for deeper connections and greater impact on startups.

This visit was a powerful testament to the distributed nature of innovation. Our exploration continues!

Weâ€™re raising funds for something close to our hearts: the NCL Technology and Entrepreneurship Club (NCL TEC) â€” a student-led initiative by research scholars and associates at National Chemical Laboratory, Pune.

This club is where curious minds come together to explore ideas, solve real-world problems, and build technologies that can make a difference. Itâ€™s a space for learning, experimenting, and growing, and itâ€™s entirely run by students!

To keep this spirit alive and thriving, weâ€™re hoping to raise Rs. 10 lakhs this season. The income from this fund goes directly into supporting the clubâ€™s activities â€” workshops, speaker sessions, early-stage prototyping, and more.

Accelerating Robotics & UAV Innovation with MATLAB & Simulink

As part of the #ProtoQuik Launchpad Cohort 1, an insightful session was conducted by Dr. Richa Singh, Application Engineer at MathWorks, along with Mr. Kapil Koul, Lead â€“ Startup Accelerator Program at MathWorks.

The session introduced the cohort to how model-based design can streamline the development of autonomous systems using MATLAB and Simulinkâ€”covering system-level simulation, motion planning, AI integration, and embedded deployment.

The session also highlighted the MathWorks Startup Accelerator Program, which supports early-stage ventures with tools, mentorship, and resources to move from idea to implementation efficiently.
